author: Jack Carr
title: Smells Like Teen Spirit: 'X-Men: Supernova' Takes Us Back To The 90s | moviepilot.com
text:
Sex, Drugs And Cobain: 'X-Men: Teen Spirit' Smells Like Dark Phoenix Unleashing Hell On The '90s February 08, 2017 at 08:57AM By Jack Carr , writer at creators.co Is Dark Phoenix coming out to play? [Credit: Marvel Comics] By Jack Carr , writer at Creators.co You are the Princess Shireen of the House Baratheon, and you are my daughter. 
Remember that time the #XMen franchise took the iconic Dark Phoenix Saga, quite possibly the greatest comic book story of all time, and made the greatest comic book movie of all time? Of course you don't, because what they actually made was X-Men: The Last Stand , a freak mutation of a movie so rotten it basically killed the X-Men movies for five years (a solid four years longer than Jean Grey ever stayed dead!). 
Despite not having been confirmed as a thing that exists by Fox yet, this week it was reported that production on Apocalypse sequel X-Men: Supernova will begin in April, shooting almost simultaneously with X-Men spin-off New Mutants in Montreal. 
Why Fox are being so secretive is anyone's guess — after being burned by the unfairly negative reaction to Apocalypse on social media, they might prefer to keep this one under wraps — but one thing we do know as of this week is that Supernova has a new working title, and it's this: 'X-Men: Teen Spirit' 
Most movies have working titles during the production shoot, and most of them are totally random and not worth dissecting, but X-Men: Teen Spirit is actually super-interesting on multiple levels. 'X-Men: Apocalypse' [Credit: Fox] 
Firstly, it seems to confirm that we'll be taking another jump through time to the '90s, seeing as that title is a clear riff on Nirvana's 1991 single "Smells Like Teen Spirit." That in itself is likely to be controversial purely for the fact that it means Professor X (and Mystique and Magneto, if they return) should be aged 50-something in this movie, while James McAvoy is actually 37 and doesn't even look it. Perhaps we'll see him buried under some a mountain of old-man prosthetics...
